meanings.definition: The number of bonds an atom can form with other atoms.
meanings.sent1: Carbon's valencies determine how many bonds it can make with other atoms.
meanings.sent2: In chemistry, we study the valencies of different elements to understand their bonding behavior.
meanings.sent3: The oxygen atom's valencies were feeling shy today and didn't want to bond with anyone.
meanings.sent4: The valencies of hydrogen and oxygen danced together to form water molecules.
meanings.sent5: Remember, the valencies of elements are like their bonding superpowers!

meanings.definition: The capacity of an element to combine with other elements.
meanings.sent1: Gold's valencies make it highly sought after for jewelry making.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are always researching the valencies of different elements to discover new compounds.
meanings.sent3: The valencies of sodium and chlorine decided to team up and create table salt.
meanings.sent4: The valencies of elements are like puzzle pieces that fit together to form compounds.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the valencies of elements helps us predict how they will react with each other.
